snippet: Conservationists try to help sustain the population by rehabilitating former captives and then releasing them into the wild in Indonesian Borneo.
abstract: Conservationists try to help sustain the population by rehabilitating former captives and then releasing them into the wild in Indonesian Borneo.
lead_paragraph: All life is precious, but the demise of the orangutan hits especially close to home. One of our closest relatives - human and orangutan genomes are 97 percent identical, a study published last year in Nature found - their population has dwindled to somewhere around 50,000.
